pullrequest.title: Move rerun failed test code to separate script

content.raw: Umm I see. The problem with mercurial is that jenkins uses it for checking the sources of some jobs even before that we start running the bash scripts, so there is very little to do with it. I think that readlink is different, we can control its installation in our scripts but you are right that it participates so early that we will need to be sure that is installed when getting the `SCRIPT_DIR` variable. I'm totally in favour of installing mercurial in /usr and I see no reason not to do the same for readlink.
